TopicTitle: [1.1.2] KSPRC - Renaissance Compilation: artworks remake [V-0.7 Pre Release 3]

Articles.Content:
I'm doubting about to keep doing stock part revamps. I don't like most of Ven's pods, but I'm in love with his engines and cupola... And despite his mod is CC-BY and can be adopted for KSPRC I wish to, at least, wait to see how Ven finish his closest plans. I the other hand I really like my new retexture for the Mk1-2...

What do you think about this topic?

I wish to do a new poll, but I don't known even how to delete the old one...

Anybody knows how to do it?

You need to request a poll deletion in this thread.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/25176-Need-a-Thread-Moving-Removing-Closing-or-Post-Deleted

Just tried to this for the first time and when KSP is starting up and loading everything it gets to TextureReplacer/KerbinScaledSpace300 and completely freezes, stops responding, and I have to close it. It does this every time I try to start it up. Is there any way I can fix this?

Could be Active Texture Manager doing its thing. Have you tried leaving it for a long time and see if it loads? And I mean a looong time: when ATM is working away at a big pile of large textures for the first time, it can take over half an hour to get through them all, in my experience.

Edited January 27, 2015 by UnanimousCoward
Fix typo.

Could be Active Texture Manager doing its thing. Have you tried leaving it for a long time and see if it loads? And I mean a looong time: when ATM is working away at a big pile of large textures for the first time, it can take over half an hour to get through them all, in my experience.

Just like to add that it also may help if you load mods one at a time; this is assuming that you're using ATM.
I use VSR, and will continue to. I do like your retextures, but the stock models really aren't worth retexturing IMHO.

My main reason for using (and craving for the new version of) KSPRC is definitely what you're doing to the planets and the overall environment, so I would totally support you focussing mostly on that.
Please keep the pod retexes as a seperate download for example! The small lander can and the Mk1-2 Pod are just supreme and incredibly beautiful

Hello Proot,

Any update on this great compilation? Your continued efforts are very much appreciated by many of us!

I keep working, right now focused on revamps. Finally I've decided to do it freely, for all those who want better looking parts but not a replacement. I have most of the wheels redone, the docking ports (all), the mk1 cockpit, and some small pieces. I just finished the Mainsail engine.. and I like it, so I now I gonna do most of the engines. All has been done to fit better with stock, but this time I've followed more the style of Space Plane Plus, instead the old Squad styles.

I keep working, right now focused on revamps. Finally I've decided to do it freely, for all those who want better looking parts but not a replacement. I have most of the wheels redone, the docking ports (all), the mk1 cockpit, and some small pieces. I just finished the Mainsail engine.. and I like it, so I now I gonna do most of the engines. All has been done to fit better with stock, but this time I've followed more the style of Space Plane Plus, instead the old Squad styles.

At this point Squad should just make this stock for 1.0.

The amount of work put into KSPRC would take months to develop by Squad, and probably wouldn't look as good!

I don't know if this has been discussed earlier, but it would be awesome if the time of day would affect how the world is tinted. For example, during sunset KSC should have an orange tint.

Keep up the great work. Installing this pack has made me come back to KSP in full force after a few months hiatus.

Is the new version still being worked on

Edited February 7, 2015 by Virtualgenius

Is the new version still be worked on

Sure is! Proot surely wouldn't leave without a heads-up first

If I read the above post by him correctly (probably not) he's working on some more texture revamps ATM.

I'm on a laptop with an AMD A8-5550M APU with no dedicated graphics device (unless you consider the APU one!)

The first time I tried this was a couple KSP versions ago, and it ran okay enough. Today was the second time I tried this, and it both looks and runs amazing!

I use openGL and DDS4KSP + DDSLoader to save memory, and other than DDS4KSP's texture compression I don't adjust or resize any of these textures. Great job!

My only gripe is that I would prefer a much darker dark side on planets, similar to Interstellar pack's dark side. Out of all the images from the Apollo missions, the ones of Earth's night side being almost impossible to distinguish from the darkness of space around it always stuck out the most for me. If I ever get sent to the moon, I'd probably spend my entire visit sitting on a rock and staring at Earth, it's just so beautiful!!

Edit: Actually, I can't remember which EVE pack did the darker night sides. I could've sworn it was Astronomer's, but I can't find any packs with the pictures I remember. || E#2: It's actually from better Atmospheres. You can stand on the launch pad, look up at the Mun, and admire its waxing phase instead of seeing a big ball of gray. || E#3: Nevermind, I have absolutely no idea which EVE pack did that, but I still want it! :C

Final edit: Please note the wonderful dark side you can find in KSPRC already. Yes, with just one quick rocket launch you are able to admire this excellent dark side that (for good reasons, probably) can't be seen within the tracking station! I am a derp. This pack is great

Edited February 8, 2015 by Nerezza

The amount of work put into KSPRC would take months to develop by Squad, and probably wouldn't look as good!

Keep up the great work. Installing this pack has made me come back to KSP in full force after a few months hiatus.

Ha,ha, many thanks!

Right now I'm working on oceans, sunsets and sunrises too. I got the oceans reflecting a much better and realistic light, with beauty oranges precisely!

I hope that Rbray89 comes back soon to update to all this new features.

Btw I'm completely available to be hired as 2D/Environmental artist!

Only interested in clouds (and volumetric clouds) and city lights, tried the clouds & lights pack from Better Atmosphere and Astronomer's Visual Pack Interstellar and KSPRC.

Feel sorry to BA & AVPI, but if I have to rate those pack, then it looks like this:

EVE default: 40 points

BA: 60 points

AVPI: 70 points

KSPRC: 300 points
Work in progress...

Wow! When will this become the official .2 release?

Great work Proot! These recent shots remind me of this:

Keep up the great art work! Waiting patiently until you have it ready for all of us to enjoy.

Work in progress...

http://i.imgur.com/P9DOZAj.jpg

I actually really like that those Rockomax tanks look like they did in 0.16-0.17.

And oh gosh, I think I'm starting to dislike the stripe on the stock FL-T400.

Question for Proot: Which plugins are you using to change the texture of an ocean (or make it seem so)? The screenshots you posted of Eve a few pages back, and these ones of the Kerbin coastline are fantastic.

Question for Proot: Which plugins are you using to change the texture of an ocean (or make it seem so)? The screenshots you posted of Eve a few pages back, and these ones of the Kerbin coastline are fantastic.

He is using the new EVE Overhaul I believe.

Sadly we can't play the environmental update until we can get the new version of Environmental Visual Enhancements mod (by Rbray89), there is a WIP version to try (which I'm using to do so much work as possible before the final release) , but still contains bugs.

Truth is that EVE and TR are two of my most favorite mods, so right now I'm like ripped in half. I hope Rbray89 back soon.
Yeah, rbray's absence is depressing ._.
Well poop, guessing this current version doesn't work with 0.90 then
